text: data [df] Long form input data one row per Bookshelf per book.

title: Long-ify data by bookshelf tags — expand_shelves
text: Tagging books different bookshelves useful way categorize books Goodreads. Books can multiple bookshelves. function creates long version data bookshelf-book combination row.

title: Long-ify data by bookshelf tags — expand_shelves
code: # This example uses our built-in books dataset. expand_shelves(books) #> # A tibble: 439 × 25 #>     Book.Id Title    Author Author.l.f Additional.Authors ISBN  ISBN13 My.Rating #>       <int> <chr>    <chr>  <chr>      <chr>              <chr> <chr>      <int> #>  1 58885849 Who’s B… Henry… Jr., Henr… "Andrew S. Infer missing publication date — set_pub_date
text: first edition publication year exist, default current edition publication year.

title: Infer missing publication date — set_pub_date
text: first_edition [integer] Input vector first edition publication year. current_edition [integer] Input vector length first_edition containing current edition publication year.

title: Infer missing publication date — set_pub_date
text: [integer] Vector length first_edition missing first edition year replaced current edition year.

title: Infer missing publication date — set_pub_date
text: books multiple editions. Original publication date always first edition. Subsequent editions stored publication date Goodreads. care chronological breadth reading habits, need know original publication date. Sometimes, first editions, Goodreads original publication empty (NA). cases, want infer original publication date edition publication date.

title: Infer missing publication date — set_pub_date
code: # This example shows missing data will be replaced. first <- c(1935, 1936, 1937, NA) current <- c(2020, 2021, 2022, 2023) set_pub_date(first, current) #> [1] 1935 1936 1937 2023  # This example shows first and current publication dates can be the same. first <- c(1935, 1936, 1937, 1938) current <- c(1935, 2021, 2022, 2023) set_pub_date(first, current) #> [1] 1935 1936 1937 1938
